Ok, thanks for the heads up. I was concerned as I wrote that that it
probably wasn't quite right, given the Smalltalk origins of so much
object- and agile-related.


----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...>
Date: Thu, 02 Sep 2004 09:26:41 -0000
Subject: Re: [junit] XUnit Framework
To: junit@yahoogroups.com

 On Thu, 2 Sep 2004 06:33:40 +0300, Allan Halme <allan.halme@...>  
 wrote:
 
 > xUnit refers to the family of Extreme Programming -inspired unit
 > testing frameworks that have arisen since the original JUnit became
 > popular. See Ron Jeffries' listing at
 > http://www.xprogramming.com/software.htm under "Unit Testing".
 
 Actually, the original was SUnit for Smalltalk. ;)
